name.bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_GB,en_U: Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter

short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Personalize your Twitter! Customize style, showcase personality. One-click control for uniqueness, Real-time interaction.
short.zh_CN: 个性化定制你的Twitter！自定义风格，展现独特个性。一键操控，实时互动，精彩不断。

long.am,ar,bg,bn,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_GB,en_U:
Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter is a powerful control panel extension designed exclusively for Twitter users, offering a range of customization features to allow users to manage and personalize their Twitter experience more flexibly. Whether you're seeking a Twitter control panel, customizing Twitter UI, adding new functionalities,, this extension can meet your diverse needs.

Instructions for Use:
● Open the Twitter website: https://twitter.com.
● Click on the extension icon in the top-right corner to open the control panel.
● In the control panel settings interface, find various personalization options such as UI adjustments, color themes, and feature toggles.
● Theme Switching: Choose your preferred theme or create a custom theme, and preview changes instantly.

Notes:
● The extension's functionality may be affected by official Twitter updates. It is recommended to regularly check for extension updates to maintain optimal performance.
● If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, please leave a message in the feedback section of the extension settings. We will respond promptly and improve the extension.


Features:

Home timeline

● Defaults to the "Following" (chronological) timeline, automatically switching you back if Twitter tries to move you to the "For you" (algorithmic) timeline
● Hide the "For you" timeline tab (default setting)
● Move Retweets to a separate tab (default setting), or hide them entirely
● Move Quote Tweets and replies to them to a separate tab in the Home timeline, or hide them entirely
● Hide Retweets in pinned Lists
● Hide tweets quoting accounts you've blocked or muted
● Mute quoting of specific tweets - adds a "Mute this conversation" menu item to Quote Tweets in the Home and List timelines
● Hide the "Home" heading
● Hide the floating "See new Tweets" button
● Hide "Who to follow", "Follow some Topics" etc. in the Home timeline and elsewhere
● Full-width timeline: hide the sidebar and let timeline content go full-width on Home, Lists and Communities

UI improvements

● Replace X branding changes
● Hide Views under tweets
● Hide the "Verified" tab on the Notifications page
● Replace Twitter Blue checkmarks with the Blue logo so they're not as easily mistaken for verified accounts, or hide them altogether
● Hide Twitter Blue replies in threads
● Hide Twitter Blue upsells throughout the app
● Hide Subscriptions
● Add "Add muted word" to the "More" menu (desktop) or slide-out menu (mobile)
● Fast blocking - skips the confirm dialog when you try to block an account
● Hide Retweets in user profiles
● Default to "Latest" tab in Search
● When viewing a tweet's Quote Tweets, hide the quoted tweet to make more room for quotes
● Hide "Open app" nags on mobile

UI tweaks

● Disable use of the Chirp font if you don't like it
● Disable bold and italic text in tweets
● Use the site's normal text font style in the primary navigation menu on desktop to make it less distracting
● Change the navigation menu density on desktop to make it take less room
● Use normal font weight in dropdown menus - if everything's bold, nothing's bold
● Uninvert the Follow and Following buttons to make them less jarring
● Choice of monochrome or themed (classic) styling for uninverted buttons

Remove algorithmic content

● Hide "What's happening", "Topics to follow" etc. in the sidebar
● Hide Explore page contents and use it only for searching
● Hide "Discover more" algorithmic tweets when viewing a tweet

Reduce "engagement"

● Hide metrics
● Reduced interaction mode: hide the action bar under tweets – replies are now the only means of interacting
● Disable the home timeline: find yourself wasting too much time on Twitter? Try preventing use of the home timeline, going to Notifications or Messages by default instead

Hide UI items you don't use

● Bookmark button under tweets
● Share button under tweets
● Analytics links under your own tweets
● Hide navigation items you don't use on desktop, and other distracting screen elements such as the Messages drawer
● Hide the bottom nav item for Messages on mobile if you don't use it often
● Hide items you don't use in the "More" menu (desktop) or slide-out menu (mobile)

Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter provides you with a more personalized and functional Twitter experience, whether on the Twitter control panel or on other platforms. We hope you enjoy the convenience and fun that this extension brings!

Disclaimer: Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter is not an official extension. Twitter™ is a trademark of Twitter Inc.

● Theme Switching: Choose your preferred theme or create a custom theme, and preview changes instantly.

Notes:
● The extension's functionality may be affected by official Twitter updates. It is recommended to regularly check for extension updates to maintain optimal performance.
● If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, please leave a message in the feedback section of the extension settings. We will respond promptly and improve the extension.


Features:

Home timeline

● Defaults to the "Following" (chronological) timeline, automatically switching you back if Twitter tries to move you to the "For you" (algorithmic) timeline
● Hide the "For you" timeline tab (default setting)
● Move Retweets to a separate tab (default setting), or hide them entirely
● Move Quote Tweets and replies to them to a separate tab in the Home timeline, or hide them entirely
● Hide Retweets in pinned Lists
● Hide tweets quoting accounts you've blocked or muted
● Mute quoting of specific tweets - adds a "Mute this conversation" menu item to Quote Tweets in the Home and List timelines
● Hide the "Home" heading
● Hide the floating "See new Tweets" button
● Hide "Who to follow", "Follow some Topics" etc. in the Home timeline and elsewhere
● Full-width timeline: hide the sidebar and let timeline content go full-width on Home, Lists and Communities

UI improvements

● Replace X branding changes
● Hide Views under tweets
● Hide the "Verified" tab on the Notifications page
● Replace Twitter Blue checkmarks with the Blue logo so they're not as easily mistaken for verified accounts, or hide them altogether
● Hide Twitter Blue replies in threads
● Hide Twitter Blue upsells throughout the app
● Hide Subscriptions
● Add "Add muted word" to the "More" menu (desktop) or slide-out menu (mobile)
● Fast blocking - skips the confirm dialog when you try to block an account
● Hide Retweets in user profiles
● Default to "Latest" tab in Search
● When viewing a tweet's Quote Tweets, hide the quoted tweet to make more room for quotes
● Hide "Open app" nags on mobile

UI tweaks

● Disable use of the Chirp font if you don't like it
● Disable bold and italic text in tweets
● Use the site's normal text font style in the primary navigation menu on desktop to make it less distracting
● Change the navigation menu density on desktop to make it take less room
● Use normal font weight in dropdown menus - if everything's bold, nothing's bold
● Uninvert the Follow and Following buttons to make them less jarring
● Choice of monochrome or themed (classic) styling for uninverted buttons

Remove algorithmic content

● Hide "What's happening", "Topics to follow" etc. in the sidebar
● Hide Explore page contents and use it only for searching
● Hide "Discover more" algorithmic tweets when viewing a tweet

Reduce "engagement"

● Hide metrics
● Reduced interaction mode: hide the action bar under tweets – replies are now the only means of interacting
● Disable the home timeline: find yourself wasting too much time on Twitter? Try preventing use of the home timeline, going to Notifications or Messages by default instead

Hide UI items you don't use

● Bookmark button under tweets
● Share button under tweets
● Analytics links under your own tweets
● Hide navigation items you don't use on desktop, and other distracting screen elements such as the Messages drawer
● Hide the bottom nav item for Messages on mobile if you don't use it often
● Hide items you don't use in the "More" menu (desktop) or slide-out menu (mobile)

Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter provides you with a more personalized and functional Twitter experience, whether on the Twitter control panel or on other platforms. We hope you enjoy the convenience and fun that this extension brings!

Disclaimer: Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter is not an official extension. Twitter™ is a trademark of Twitter Inc.

long.zh_CN:
Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter是一款专为Twitter用户设计的强大控制面板插件，提供了一系列定制化功能，让用户能够更灵活地管理和个性化他们的Twitter体验。无论您是寻找Twitter控制面板、自定义Twitter UI、添加新功能等，这个插件都能够满足您的需求。


使用说明：
● 打开Twitter网站： https://twitter.com
● 点击右上角插件图标，打开控制面板。
● 在控制面板的设置界面中，找到各种个性化选项，如UI调整、颜色主题和功能开关。
● 主题切换：选择喜欢的主题或创建自定义主题，并即时预览效果。

主要功能：
主页时间线

● 默认使用 "正在关注"（按时间顺序）的时间线
  ● 隐藏 "为你推荐" (算法) 时间线
● 转发
  ● 在单独的标签中显示
● 隐藏引用你已经屏蔽或隐藏的账户的推文
● 对特定推文进行隐藏引用
  ● 在引用推文中增加了一个"将此对话隐藏"的菜单项
● 隐藏"查看新推文"
● 在时间线中隐藏"关注谁", "关注一些话题"等
● 全宽的时间线内容
  ● 隐藏侧边栏，让时间线内容全宽化

用户界面改进

● 更换 X 品牌变更
● 隐藏推文下的观点
● 隐藏通知菜单中的"已认证"标签
● Twitter Blue认证标记
  ● 替换为Twitter Blue标识
● 隐藏Twitter Blue的回复
● 隐藏Twitter Blue强制销售
● 隐藏订阅服务
● 在"更多"菜单中添加"增加隐藏词"
● 快速屏蔽(跳过确认对话框)
● 在用户个人资料中隐藏转发
● 在搜索中默认为"最新"选项卡
● 查看引用推文时隐藏被引用的推文

用户界面调整

● 不要使用Chirp字体
● 禁用推文中的加粗和斜体文本
● 在导航栏中使用正常的文本字体样式
● 导航密度
  ● 舒适 / 紧凑
● 在下拉菜单中使用正常的字体大小
● 取消 关注着/正在关注 按钮
  ● 单色 / 主题

删除算法性内容

● 在侧边栏中隐藏 "有什么新鲜事？", "你可能会喜欢"等
● 隐藏"探索"页面内容，只用于搜索
● 隐藏"发现更多"推文

降低 "参与"

● 隐藏指标
● 减少互动模式
  ● 隐藏推文下的动作栏--回复现在是唯一的互动方式
● 禁用主页时间线
  ● 发现自己在Twitter上浪费了太多的时间？试着防止使用主页时间线

隐藏你不使用的用户界面项目

● 推文下方的书签按钮
● 推文下的分享按钮
● 帐户切换
● 讯息抽屉
● 隐藏你不使用的"更多"菜单项

注意事项：
● 插件的功能可能会受到Twitter官方更新的影响，建议定期检查插件更新以保持最佳性能。
● 如果遇到任何问题或有建议，请在插件设置界面中的反馈区域留言，我们将及时回复并改进插件。

Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter为您提供了一个更具个性和功能的Twitter体验，无论是在Twitter控制面板还是在其他平台上，都能为您打造定制化的社交媒体体验。希望您享受使用这款插件带来的便利和乐趣！

免责声明：Twitter UI - Control Panel For Twitter并非官方插件。Twitter™是Twitter Inc.的商标。
